poem:
In Silent Streets  

a whisper of hair  
beneath veils of mandate,  
streets echo  
the soft rebellion  
of uncovered dreams—  
  
where petals fall,  
not in shame,  
but in quiet defiance,  
daring to bloom  
against unyielding stone.
